definitions.definition: To incorporate nutrients into the body , especially after digestion .
examples: Food is assimilated and converted into organic tissue.

definitions.definition: To incorporate or absorb ( knowledge ) into the mind .
examples: The teacher paused in her lecture to allow the students to assimilate what she had said.

definitions.definition: To absorb (a person or people) into a community or culture .
examples: The aliens in the science-fiction film wanted to assimilate human beings into their own race.

definitions.definition: To liken , compare to something similar .
To bring to a likeness or to conformity; to cause a resemblance between.
To be incorporated or absorbed into something.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To incorporate nutrients into the body , especially after digestion .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To incorporate or absorb ( knowledge ) into the mind .
( transitive ) To absorb (a person or people) into a community or culture .
( transitive , rare , used with "to" or "with" ) To liken , compare to something similar .
( transitive ) To bring to a likeness or to conformity; to cause a resemblance between.
( intransitive ) To be incorporated or absorbed into something.
